content.description: Might be a decent route if it had more traffic. The rock is a bit chossy around the last two bolts where it gets a bit slabby.
content.location: The west face of the pincer. Starts right next to (right side) of the fallen tree resting on the rock.

content.description: The crux is right off the ground and extends until the 3rd bolt. Really fun route that demands strong calves and a cool head. Falling before the first bolt would end pretty bad. The rock surface does not lend itself to smearing so some creativity is required for your feet. The middle of the route is the easiest and allows for a decent rest, and while the top isn't as hard as the bottem it still requires some delicate footwork.
content.location: Backside of The Pincer, to the right of Tool Boys and the fallen tree.

content.description:
This is a bolted (6) sport route that could also be trad led.   Fun route that takes you to the lower of the two spires.  Pass the shuts and climb around to the left of the lower spire to gain its apex.

Scramble up from the belay area to the right to gain the crack.  Clip the bolt then get out on the face and use whatever you want.
content.protection: Metolius anchors at the top.  6 bolts.   If trad led, probably would want a #4 and a #3.
content.location:
On the East Face of The Pincer.  If approaching from Roadside Block, walk up the gulley until you see a right trending ledge that you scramble up to gain the belay stance.   From a tree, belay fellow climbers up through the scramble area for added safety.

There's an alternate scramble option on the West face.
